contentrichtext.text: {{Other people|John Williams}} {{Infobox CanadianMP | name='''John G. Williams''' <!-- Commented out because image was deleted: | image=johnwilliams.JPG --> | term_start=[[Canadian federal election, 1993|1993]] | term_end=[[Canadian federal election, 2008|2008]] | predecessor=[[Walter Van De Walle]] | birth_date={{birth date and age|1946|12|31}} | birth_place={{flagicon|Scotland}} [[Aberdeenshire, Scotland]] | successor=[[Brent Rathgeber]] | death_date= | death_place= | profession=Accountant | party=[[Conservative Party of Canada|Conservative]] | party colour=Conservative | residence=[[St. Albert, Alberta]] | riding=[[Edmonton—St. Albert]] | footnotes= | term_start2= | term_end2= | predecessor2= | successor2= | spouse=Christine Botchway | religion= |}} '''John G. Williams''' (born December 31, 1946) was a [[Conservative Party of Canada|Conservative]] MP representing [[Edmonton—St. Albert]] in the [[Canadian parliament]] from 1993 to 2008. He was born in [[Aberdeenshire (historic)|Aberdeenshire]], [[Scotland]]. Originally associated with the [[Reform Party of Canada|Reform Party]], he was a member of the Conservatives since its formation in 2003. He has been a long time chair of the [[Canadian House of Commons Standing Committee on Public Accounts|Public Accounts Committee]] in the [[Canadian House of Commons]]. In August 2006, he announced that he would not be seeking re-election in the [[Canadian federal election, 2008|next federal election]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/edmonton/story/2006/08/10/williams-retires.html |title=Edmonton-St. Albert MP won't run again |work=[[CBC News]] |date=August 11, 2006}}</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *{{CanParlbio|ID=233caca3-acc5-4554-9c4f-4abf75950440}} {{s-start}} {{s-off}} {{succession box|title=[[Canadian House of Commons Standing Committee on Public Accounts|Chairman of the Public Accounts Committee]]| before=[[Michel Guimond]]| after=[[Shawn Murphy]]| years=1997–2005}} {{s-end}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Williams, John | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Canadian politician | DATE OF BIRTH =December 31, 1946 | PLACE OF BIRTH =[[Aberdeenshire, Scotland]] | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Williams, John}} [[Category:1946 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Members of the House of Commons of Canada from Alberta]] [[Category:Conservative Party of Canada MPs]] [[Category:Canadian Alliance MPs]] [[Category:Reform Party of Canada MPs]] [[Category:Scottish emigrants to Canada]] [[Category:Canadian Presbyterians]] [[Category:People from Aberdeenshire]] {{Alberta-politician-stub}}
